subject: Re: [junit] jar file for com.mock.servlet.*
msgSnippet: There are a number of different mock frameworks out there, each of which has good points and bad points. If you re using Spring to develop your web application
messageBody:
There are a number of different mock frameworks out there, each of which has good points and bad points. If you're using
Spring to develop your web application (good times), it contains its own mock classes. If you're not using Spring (bad
times), I suggest JMock (www.jmock.org).

---
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/
